bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Rairdon began as a lineman in Jamestown, ND for Northwestern Bell in 1927. He became a union activist in the late 1930s while working in Bismarck, ND and was a charter member of the National Federation of Telephone Workers. Rairdon served as a delegate to the first convention of the Communication Workers of America (CWA) in 1948. He was a member of the CWA staff in Fargo, ND from 1951 until his retirement in 1973.
